wikipedia_page.main: George Reginald Balleine (1 April 1873 – 2 January 1966) was a prominent historian and writer in the Island of Jersey.

response: *George Reginald Balleine: Past finding out, the tragic story of Joanna Southcott and her successors. London: S.P.C.K., 1956

Notable members have included Dr Robert Ranulph Marett, the leading early evolutionary anthropologist, whose father Robert Pipon Marett was a founder member; Dr Arthur Mourant FRS a noted haematologist and George Reginald Balleine historian and clergyman. Geraint Jennings, writer and politician, is also a member.
*George Reginald Balleine. (1948). A Biographical Dictionary of Jersey. Staples Press.
*A Biographical Dictionary of Jersey, volume I – George Reginald Balleine, 1993 (750)
*A Biographical Dictionary of Jersey, volume II – George Reginald Balleine, 1993 (750)
George Reginald Balleine wrote about Witch Trials in Jersey, naming "the Witches' Rock at St. Clement", however his work is questioned as being naive about torture and resulting confessions.
